intro: Senecio herbichia, commonly known as the herbichia groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
